## Decision Modeling Overview & Decision Trees

Monday, November 14, 2022

**Readings:**

- Eskander A, et al. To ban or not to ban tanning bed use for minors: A cost‐effectiveness analysis from multiple US perspectives for invasive melanoma. Cancer. 2021;127(13):2333-41. [https://doi.org/10.1002/cncr.33499](https://doi.org/10.1002/cncr.33499) *Read for high-level understanding. It’s ok if you don’t follow all the model details yet.*

- Cipriano LE, et al. The cost‐effectiveness of expanding newborn screening for up to 21 inherited metabolic disorders using tandem mass spectrometry: results from a decision‐analytic model. Value in Health. 2007;10(2):83-97.[https://doi.org/10.1111/j.1524-4733.2006.00156.x]( https://doi.org/10.1111/j.1524-4733.2006.00156.x)

**Schedule:**

|                            |            |
|---------------|:-----------------------------------------|
| 10:00am – 10:15am   | Workshop orientation |
| 10:15am – 10:45am  | Overview of decision modeling and cost-effectiveness analysis | 
| 10:45am – 11:15am | Break out exercise: Indoor tanning (Eskander et al.) case study discussion |
| 11:15am – 12:00pm | Decision Trees |
| 12:00pm – 12:30pm | Decision tree exercise: Mosquito-borne disease control  |


**Learning objectives:**

- Understand the premise of decision analysis as applied to public health and health care
- Understand the role of perspective in an analysis
- Identify the inputs needed to conduct a decision or cost-effectiveness analysis
- Synthesize information into a decision tree
